message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to discuss the sale of this unique product with you. I believe it has tremendous value and I'm looking forward to hearing your thoughts. My initial offer is $1200000.
I'm interested in the product, but I think $800000 is a more reasonable price. I'm willing to pay $950000 for it.

I appreciate your interest in the product, Bob. However, I was thinking more along the lines of $1100000. I believe the product's value is worth more than your initial suggestion of $800000, and my counteroffer reflects that. I'm willing to meet you halfway, but I need to ensure I'm getting a fair price for it.

I understand that you think the product is valuable, but I'm not willing to go above $950000. I'm willing to meet you halfway between $950000 and $1100000, so I'll offer $975000. Can we meet at this price?

I appreciate your willingness to meet in the middle, Bob. However, I'm not quite ready to accept $975000. I'm willing to make one more concession, but I need to get closer to my target price. I'm thinking of $1050000. Let's see if we can meet at this price.
I understand you're trying to get closer to your target price, but I'm still not willing to go above $975000. I'll make one more concession and meet you at $1000000. Can we meet at this price?

I appreciate your concession, Bob, but I'm still not comfortable with $1000000. I'm willing to make one more counteroffer, but I need to get closer to my target price. I'm thinking of $1075000. Let's see if we can meet at this price.
I understand you're trying to get closer to your target price, but I'm still not willing to go above $1050000. I'll make one last concession and meet you at $1050000. This is my final offer.

I appreciate your final concession, Bob, but I'm still not willing to accept $1050000. I've already made significant concessions, and I'm not willing to go any lower than my previous offer of $1075000. I'm willing to walk away from the deal if we can't meet at this price.
